an5.152:4.1: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an5.152:4.3: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re witless, dull, and stupid. They think they know what they don’t know.
an5.152:4.4: Someone with these five qualities is unable to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.
an5.152:5.1: Someone with five qualities is able to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities when listening to the true teaching.
an5.152:5.3: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re wise, not dull and stupid. They don’t think they know what they don’t know.
an5.152:5.4: Someone with these five qualities is able to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
